meanings.definition: Make (a situation) less tense or dangerous.
meanings.sent1: She tried to defuse the argument by calmly explaining her point of view.
meanings.sent2: The police officer was able to defuse the situation before it escalated.
meanings.sent3: To defuse the tension, they decided to watch a funny movie together.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to defuse any conflict that arose.
meanings.sent5: Using humor can be a great way to defuse a difficult situation.

meanings.definition: Remove the fuse from (an explosive device) in order to prevent it from exploding.
meanings.sent1: The bomb squad was called in to defuse the explosive device found in the building.
meanings.sent2: He carefully defused the bomb, ensuring everyone's safety.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the hero had to defuse the bomb with only seconds to spare.
meanings.sent4: She felt a rush of adrenaline as she worked to defuse the ticking time bomb.
meanings.sent5: The expert was able to defuse the bomb with precision and skill.
